name: ls
description: List directory contents
longDescription: The ls command is used to list files and directories in a directory. It provides information about file types, permissions, and other metadata.

arguments.name: -a
arguments.description: Do not ignore entries starting with .

arguments.name: -h
arguments.description: Print sizes in human readable format

name: cd
description: Change the current directory
longDescription: The cd command is used to change the current working directory in a shell session. It allows you to navigate the file system hierarchy.

arguments.description: Move to the user's home directory

name: mkdir
description: Make directories
longDescription: The mkdir command is used to create new directories in the file system. It can create multiple directories at once and create parent directories as needed.

arguments.name: -v
arguments.description: Print a message for each created directory

name: grep
description: Search for patterns in files
longDescription: The grep command searches for patterns in files or standard input. It can display lines that match a specified pattern.

arguments.name: -n
arguments.description: Print line numbers with output lines

name: chmod
description: Change file mode bits
longDescription: The chmod command is used to change the permissions of files and directories. It can modify read, write, and execute permissions for the owner, group, and others.

arguments.name: -v
arguments.description: Output a diagnostic for every file processed

name: ps
description: Report a snapshot of the current processes
longDescription: The ps command provides information about currently running processes, including their process ID, CPU usage, memory usage, and more.

arguments.name: -u
arguments.description: Select by effective user ID or name

name: ssh
description: Secure Shell, a protocol for securely accessing remote machines.
longDescription: The ssh command is used to establish a secure connection to a remote machine over an unsecured network, allowing for secure remote login and other secure network services.

arguments.name: -p PORT
arguments.description: Specifies the port to connect to on the remote host.

arguments.name: -i IDENTITY_FILE
arguments.description: Selects a file from which the identity (private key) for public key authentication is read.

name: telnet
description: A protocol for text-based communication with remote devices.
longDescription: The telnet command allows users to connect to remote servers and perform operations through a command-line interface, but it is not secure as it transmits data in plaintext.

arguments.name: -l USER
arguments.description: Specifies the user to log in as.

name: nc
description: Netcat, a utility for reading from and writing to network connections.
longDescription: The nc command can create TCP or UDP connections and is useful for network diagnostics and data transfer, acting as a simple network data pipeline.

name: ncat
description: An enhanced version of netcat, part of the Nmap suite.
longDescription: The ncat command is designed for networking and can handle connections in various modes, providing features like SSL support and IPv6.

name: socat
description: A command-line based utility that establishes two bidirectional byte streams.
longDescription: The socat command can connect two network sockets, allowing for complex networking setups and enabling data transfers between different types of endpoints.

name: openssl
description: A toolkit for the Transport Layer Security (TLS) and Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocols.
longDescription: The openssl command is used for creating and managing SSL/TLS certificates and performing secure network communications.

arguments.name: COMMAND
arguments.description: The specific OpenSSL command to run (e.g., s_client, req).

arguments.name: -days N
arguments.description: Specifies the number of days the certificate is valid.

name: s_client
description: A command in OpenSSL for testing SSL/TLS connections.
longDescription: The s_client command connects to a specified host and port and establishes an SSL/TLS connection, providing information about the SSL certificate and encryption used.

arguments.name: -showcerts
arguments.description: Displays all certificates in the chain.

arguments.name: -starttls PROTOCOL
arguments.description: Initiates a TLS handshake for specified protocol (e.g., smtp).

name: nmap
description: A network scanning tool used to discover hosts and services on a computer network.
longDescription: The nmap command is widely used for security auditing, network inventory, and discovering devices on a network.

arguments.name: -sP
arguments.description: Ping scan - determines which hosts are up.

name: netstat
description: A networking utility that displays network connections, routing tables, and interface statistics.
longDescription: The netstat command provides insights into network connections, listening ports, and protocol statistics, useful for troubleshooting and monitoring network activity.

arguments.name: -a
arguments.description: Displays all connections and listening ports.

name: ss
description: A utility to investigate sockets, providing similar information to netstat but with a more modern design.
longDescription: The ss command is faster and can provide more detailed information about sockets, making it suitable for troubleshooting and performance analysis.

name: sort
description: Sort lines of text files.
longDescription: The sort command arranges the lines of input files or standard input in a specific order, which by default is lexicographical.

name: uniq
description: Report or omit repeated lines.
longDescription: The uniq command filters out adjacent duplicate lines from the input and displays unique lines, often used after sort.

arguments.name: -c
arguments.description: Precedes each output line with the number of occurrences.

name: strings
description: Find printable strings in files.
longDescription: The strings command searches binary files for printable strings, which can be useful in reverse engineering or extracting text from non-text files.

arguments.name: -n LENGTH
arguments.description: Specify the minimum string length to print.

name: base64
description: Encode and decode data using base64 encoding.
longDescription: The base64 command is used to encode binary data as ASCII text and to decode base64 encoded data.

arguments.name: -d
arguments.description: Decode data instead of encoding it.

name: tr
description: Translate or delete characters.
longDescription: The tr command translates or deletes characters from the input based on the specified sets of characters.

arguments.name: -s
arguments.description: Squeeze repeated characters from the output.

name: tar
description: Create or extract tar archives.
longDescription: The tar command is used to create, modify, and extract files from a tarball, which is an archive of files.

name: gzip
description: Compress files using gzip compression.
longDescription: The gzip command compresses files using the Lempel-Ziv algorithm, reducing file size while retaining the original data.

arguments.name: -k
arguments.description: Keep the original file after compression.

name: bzip2
description: Compress files using bzip2 compression.
longDescription: The bzip2 command compresses files using the Burrows-Wheeler algorithm, achieving higher compression ratios than gzip.

arguments.name: -k
arguments.description: Keep the original file after compression.

name: xxd
description: Make a hexdump or reverse it.
longDescription: The xxd command creates a hex dump of a file and can reverse the operation, converting hex data back into its original form.

arguments.name: -r
arguments.description: Reverse operation, convert hex dump back to binary.

name: cp
description: Copy files and directories.
longDescription: The cp command copies files and directories from one location to another, preserving attributes such as timestamps.

arguments.name: -r
arguments.description: Recursively copy directories and their contents.

name: mv
description: Move or rename files and directories.
longDescription: The mv command moves files and directories to a different location or renames them.

arguments.name: -n
arguments.description: Do not overwrite any existing files.

name: file
description: Determine the type of a file.
longDescription: The file command examines a file's contents and determines its type based on the file's magic number and other characteristics.

arguments.name: -i
arguments.description: Display the MIME type of the file.
